meanings.sent1: I found a quin in my pocket and used it to buy some candy.
meanings.sent2: He handed the cashier a quin to pay for his coffee.
meanings.sent3: The quin in my wallet was feeling lonely among the singles.
meanings.sent4: The quin sat proudly in the wallet, surrounded by lesser bills.
meanings.sent5: The shiny quin caught my eye as I counted my money.

meanings.sent1: The doctor prescribed a quin to help with the fever.
meanings.sent2: She mixed the quin into the tonic to make a refreshing drink.
meanings.sent3: The quin seemed to dance in the glass of water before disappearing.
meanings.sent4: The effect of the quin was like a cool breeze on a hot day.
meanings.sent5: The bitter taste of the quin lingered on her tongue.

meanings.definition: A suffix meaning a group of five
meanings.sent1: The team was made up of a quin of players, each with a specific role.
meanings.sent2: She counted a quin of apples in the basket.
meanings.sent3: The quin of ducks waddled in a straight line, looking quite organized.
meanings.sent4: The quin of stars shone brightly in the night sky.
meanings.sent5: The quin of fingers on his hand worked together to complete the task.
